alert.note: Alert for Marion (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 06 at 6:24PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Marion County through 715 PM CDT... At 624 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Weston, or over Hamilton, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Hamilton, Winfield, Guin, Brilliant, Brinn, Weston, Lake Buttahatchee, Twin, Pearces Mill, Rankin Fite Airport, Marion County Public Lake, Piney Grove and Pikeville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
